meanings.definition: Fill in (an excavated hole or trench) with the material dug out during excavation.
meanings.sent1: After digging the hole, they backfilled it with the dirt they had removed.
meanings.sent2: The workers backfilled the trench with the soil they had dug up.
meanings.sent3: The team backfilled the hole with the same dirt they had just unearthed.
meanings.sent4: She backfilled the trench with memories of the past.
meanings.sent5: The garden was backfilled with colorful flowers, creating a beautiful sight.

meanings.definition: Fill in (a hole or trench) with material that has been excavated.
meanings.sent1: The construction crew backfilled the hole with the rocks they had removed earlier.
meanings.sent2: They backfilled the trench with the sand they had excavated.
meanings.sent3: The kids backfilled the hole with the same sand they had dug out.
meanings.sent4: His heart felt backfilled with joy after seeing her smile.
meanings.sent5: The jar was backfilled with marbles, creating a colorful display.
